page.title: 02OLD HOUSES IN DUNSFORD
page.content: Dunsford has many old houses making up the backbone of the village.Most of them are made of cob and thatch,though some of the old thatch roofs have been converted to slate.In Reedy, a small suburb of Dunsford there are several old houses.One of which,called Reedy Corner Cottage,is 400hundred years old It was once a barn belonging to a nearby house.It was changed into a house with a thatched roof and eventully to it's present state with a slate roof.Further on is another old thatched house which has recently been re-thatched.In the main village there are many old houses.One of them, situtated off the main road was mentioned in the origional Domesday book.It has been repaired many times since then.
